Dear Jason M Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Description
written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 punched Youth A in the face after Youth A made racial
slurs and spit in Staff 1's face.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 6/24/2024. He
reported receiving the information regarding the allegations from
Supervisor 3 on the day of the incident (6/22/24). He reported
Staff 1 called Supervisor 3 and informed her of the incident and
Supervisor 3 informed Staff 1 that he was “verbally terminated”.
Supervisor 3 informed Staff 1 that an official termination would
follow but he should not return to campus. Complainant reported
being informed by Supervisor 1 of the incident report number but
also having no further information about the allegations.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/25/2024 and 6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
He had no firsthand knowledge of the incident. Administrator 1
reported Staff 1 had a “soft” termination on the day of the incident
and will be officially terminated. Staff 1 will also not be allowed
back on campus. He reported there is no video recording of the
incident involved in the allegations. He reported there has been
regular staff meeting to discuss the treatment of Youth A and what
interventions will work best to support Youth A making the
necessary changes. He reported Youth A tends to fight other
youth and has been observed bullying Youth B and Youth C on
several occasions. Staff have always quickly intervened.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/25/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported being in this placement since sometime in March 2024
and is fearful because “some of the peers” want to beat Youth A
up. Youth A reported other peers want to beat him because Youth
2

A got a staff fired for punching Youth A and this was a favorite
staff by several peers. Youth A reported the incident began when
Youth A asked Staff 1 to use to the phone to call Youth A’s mother
and Staff 1 told Youth A that Staff 1 is not his mother nor father.
Youth A became very upset over this statement because Youth A
is not with his mother and Youth A’s father has passed away.
Youth A reported asking again to call Youth A’s mother and Staff 1
told him no. Youth A reported walking towards his room when
Supervisor 1 tried to speak with Youth A. Youth A told Supervisor
1 to stop speaking to Youth A and Youth A threw a “piece” of
paper at Supervisor 1. This caused Supervisor 1 to restrain Youth
A. Staff (unidentified) called an “all clear” and all youth with the
exception of Youth A were removed from the hallway. After the
“restraint”, Youth A went into the milieu and “broke everything”.
Youth A then reported he broke a key fob that caused a mark on
Youth A’s left wrist and broke a light. Youth A reported this is
when staff (unidentified) call for Supervisor 2, who showed up on
the unit. Youth A reported at this time, Youth A spit in Staff 1’s
face causing Staff 1 to punch Youth A in the left cheek. Youth A
denied making any racial remarks to Staff 1 prior to the punch.
Youth A reported Supervisor 3 was present. Youth A reported
there were no youth present to witness the incidents because an
“all clear” had been called. Youth A believed the mark on his
upper right arm was caused by the restraint performed by
Supervisor 1. Following the punching incident, Youth A reported
being in the milieu alone because the other youth were
somewhere else, and all of the staff were in the staff office. Youth
A reported receiving medical attention following the incident and
being checked by nursing staff. Numerous times throughout the
interview of Youth A, Youth A stated not feelings safe at the facility
because Youth A doesn’t know how to fight, and Youth C had
fought Youth A “four times”. Once Youth C punched Youth A in
the head 4 times, knocking Youth A unconscious. Youth A wanted
the MDHHS worker to move Youth A to another unit until Foster
Care Worker can move Youth A to a new placement. Another fear
Youth A reported was that staff (unidentified) keep hitting Youth A,
but Youth A was unable to provide any specific information on
who, when, and where.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
Youth A and Youth C both are “bullies” and Youth A engaged in
destruction daily. Youth B reported never seeing staff harm or hurt
Youth A but has seen Youth A hurt staff. Youth B reported
witnessing Youth A punch and spit on Staff 1. Youth B reported
feeling safe at the facility and taken care of by staff. Youth B
3

reported staff intervene when Youth A or Youth C start bullying
others.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
reported being on a home pass when the incident outlined in the
allegations occurred. He reported having trouble with Youth A
because Youth A will just walk up to Youth C and punch him
without provocation. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth C
fought a couple of days ago after Youth A hit Youth C. Youth C
reported Youth A acts aggressively on most day and has struck
staff several times. He observed Youth A strike a female staff
(investigated in special investigation 2024SIC0001327) and punch
and spit on different staff. Youth C reported staff as always
appropriate with restraints and the only time a youth gets hurt
during a restraint is if the youth is fighting the restraint. Youth C
reported being restrained twice and didn’t resist so he was “ok”
with the restraint. Youth C views Staff 1 as a “good staff”. Youth C
reported being in this placement for the past year and a half and
feels safe in the placement.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
receiving a call on the day of the incident from Staff 1 stating
Youth A was in a restraint in the north hallway. Upon arriving at
the unit, Supervisor 2 found Youth A in a restraint by Supervisor 1.
Staff 1 was clearing the milieu of youth and Supervisor 2 called
nursing staff to inform them about the restraint. During the
restraint, Youth A was attempting to grab Supervisor 1’s keys and
trying to scratch Supervisor 1. After transporting Youth A to the
milieu, Youth A was released in the milieu by Supervisor 1. Youth
A began to target Supervisor 1 by tearing items off the wall and
trying to use these items as a weapon. Staff 1 was trying to hold a
table that Youth A was attempting to pick up, but Supervisor 2 was
able to gain control of the table and removed it to the staff office.
Youth A punched Supervisor 2 in the chest as Supervisor 2
removed the table. Youth A acted like Youth A was going to punch
Staff 1 before spitting in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 hit the left side of
Youth A’s cheek with his hand. Supervisor 2 told Staff 1 to leave
the area. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was making racial slurs
towards Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 throughout the incident,
beginning with the restraint in the hallway. Supervisor 3 came to
the unit after receiving information about the incident.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
4

receiving a phone call from Staff 1 while at home and being
informed of the incident. She reported Staff 1 informed her that
Youth A had done damage to the unit and was assaulting different
staff including Supervisor 1. Staff 1 explained what had occurred
with the requested phone call and Staff 1 telling Youth A that
Youth A would have to wait until Supervisor 1 returned before a
phone call would be made. Staff 1 reported to Supervisor 3 he
informed Youth A that Staff 1 was unable to leave the unit to
assist with the phone call because there were other youth on the
unit that needed supervision. After receiving the same response,
Youth A attacked Staff 1 and spit in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 reported
striking Youth A in the face as a reaction to the spitting. Staff 1
informed Supervisor 3 that he was standing outside of the unit
since Supervisor 2 told him to leave following the incident.
Supervisor 3 reported telling Staff 1 that he knows what this
means and to turn in his keys and leave campus. Supervisor 3
reported calling Administrator 2 who confirmed what action to take
with Staff 1. Supervisor 3 called nursing staff who assessed Youth
A.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on 6/27/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being in
another room on the unit with three other youth when the incident
occurred. She reported being told by Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 to
wait in this other space until the situation was under control. She
reported not witnessing anything firsthand except when entering
the milieu, noticing that there were several broken items laying
around the room. She did have knowledge of the incident but was
told by Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 of what occurred.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
6/27/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
the incident began with Youth A refusing to eat lunch and running
down the hallway. Supervisor 1 followed and when turning around
to leave Youth A, Youth A ran after Supervisor 1 throwing
something at Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 initiated a single person
standing hold before taking Youth A to the floor to a sitting position
(this was all viewed on the video recording and matched what
Supervisor 1 reported). After transporting Youth A to the milieu
and releasing Youth A, Youth A began to destroy items in the
room. Supervisor 1 removed himself, believing that he maybe
trigging Youth A. Supervisor 1 went into the staff office and Youth
A began to attack Supervisor 3 and Staff 1. As Youth A was
tipping over a table, Staff 1 caught the table and Youth A moved
to punch Staff 1 before spitting in Staff 1’s face. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 1 hit Youth A in the face and then went outside.
5

Youth A informed Supervisor 1 that Youth A wants to get staff
fired and is glad that Staff 1 will be fired for hitting Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported being threatened by Youth A several times
in the past with Youth A voicing a motive of wanting to be moved
to a different unit or placement.
Staff 1 is refusing to speak or be interviewed at this time. He
indicated having a lawyer who has advised against any interviews.
Video Reviewed:
Although the agency has cameras, the camera in the milieu where
Staff 1 punched Youth A was broken so no video footage was
available for review.
Documents Reviewed:
MDHHS interview with Youth A dated 6/23/2024. This
document states “Later in the day yesterday, about 2:00pm, Youth
A wanted to use the phone to call his mom. He gets 1-2 phone
calls a day and will typically call his mother. Staff member, Staff 1
told Youth A that he could not use the phone, which escalated
Youth A. After Youth A was told he couldn’t use the phone, he spit
in Staff 1’s face, and Staff 1 punched Youth A one-time on the left
side of his face with a closed fist. After he punched Youth A, he
backed off immediately.”
Wedgwood Christian Services Behavior Management
Procedures – Prohibited Techniques 05.01.2 dated 7/13/2023.
This document outlines the behavior management techniques that
are prohibited. The first line states “Corporal or physical
punishment including, hitting”.
Wedgwood Christian Services Behavior Management Report #
11068 for Youth A dated 6/22/2024. This document outlines the
incident described in the allegations and notes that “Staff 1,
immediately punched Youth A” after Youth A spat on Staff 1.
Other narrative outlined in this document match what was
reported by Youth A and staff interviewed. The restraint was
initiated for “significant danger to others” and the holds used by
Supervisor 1 are documented as “1 person seated” and “escort”.
Debriefing was conducted with both staff and Youth A and Nurse
documents assessing Youth A. This report is also documented to
have been reviewed by Administrator 1.
Nursing Note dated 6/22/24 for Youth A and signed by Nurse.
It is documented that Nurse was notified of physical management
of Youth A by Supervisor 2. It is also documented Youth A
6

sustained a cut on his right wrist after being cut when trying to
throw a pole that he tore off the wall. It is documented as Youth A
threw the pole that had wires still attached to the wall, it snaped
back on him when it reached the end of the wires and hit Youth A
on the right wrist. Nurse showed up on unit to assess Youth A and
it was noticed that Youth A had a small bruise on left cheek. Youth
A informed Nurse that his wrist was hurt when trying to throw the
pipe connected the key fob that he tore off the wall. Three other
wounds were noticed on Youth A, but he denies knowing how
these were caused or when.
Nursing Note dated 6/23/24 for Youth A and signed by Nurse.
Youth A was complaining of right wrist pain. Upon assessment,
Youth A had a cut on his right wrist, and it was swollen and
painful. Recommended an application of ice as well as Ibuprofen
for pain. Nursing will follow up on 6/24/24.
Nursing Note dated 6/24/24 for Youth A and signed by Nurse.
It is documented Youth A was assessed by Doctor at the facility.
The wound on right wrist is scabbed over and there is no sign of
infection. It is also documented there is a small bruise on left
cheek/eye from being struck on Saturday. Youth A is not
complaining of any lingering pain or vision change. Nurse will
continue to monitor and intervene as needed.
Staff 1’s personnel file: Documentation indicates Staff 1 was
hired on 9/11/2023 and there are disciplinary action documents in
the file including speeding, and two issues with supervision.
6/24/24 email from HR department. Documents Staff 1 is
terminated and not eligible for rehire. Staff 1’s last day of
employment with the facility is documented as 6/24/24.
Documentation in the file indicates Staff 1 completed the following
trainings:
• Trauma Sensitive on 11/16/2023.
• Communication and Conflict Management Skills on
9/14/2023.
• Crisis Management Basics for Paraprofessionals on
9/14/2023.
• AEGIS – Crisis Prevention & De-escalation on 10/16/2023.
• Introduction to Trauma-Informed Care on 9/14/2023.
• Professional Boundaries on 1/30/24.
• Traumatic Stress Prevention & Self-Care on 9/14/2023.
7

• Wellness Center Orientation on 9/11/2023.
Kentwood Police Department Case #2024-00012735 Dated
6/27/24. This document outlines the contact Law Enforcement had
with Staff 1 on 6/27/24. The contact occurred by phone and Staff 1
informed Law Enforcement he wanted to press charges against
Youth A. It is documented Staff 1 reported Youth A was
dysregulated and walked up to Staff 1, backing Staff 1 in the
corner before swings on Staff 1 and then spitting in Staff 1’s face.
Staff 1 reported the spitting was a “splatter” all over Staff 1’s face.
Staff 1 admitted that he threw his arms in front of him to dodge the
spit and that is when one of his hands hit Youth A in the face. Staff
1 is reported to saying he saw the spit coming and this was his
reaction.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as interviews with Youth
A, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 confirm Staff 1 hit Youth A in the
face. Additionally, Supervisor 3 reported Staff 1 informed her Staff
1 hit Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
